comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: In 1888, Mason Brothers were listed as connected to the GPO Central Telephone Exchange, #190. One of the regulations of conducting business through the exchange was that "Telephone Messages containing unbecoming expressions must be refrained from" - see Sands Sydney Directory 1888: Telephonic - Customs & Stamp duties - Wharfage & Tonnage rates - Firms with fixed pay days

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] AB, can you please upload to Flickr the last remaining "vignetting" image that [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00] identified - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... I've gathered them together here - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/galleries/72157627467313436]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Google maps shows 277 Kent Street on the west side between Eskine and Margaret Streets. Which makes the shadows all wrong on this building - it looks like it faces west. Hmmm? maps.google.com/maps?q=277+Kent+Street,+Sydney,+NSW,+Aust...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The 'Trades and Professional' section of the 1888 Sands has 263-277 Kent Street listed. The shadows would indicate the photo was taken in the morning?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] If it was a morning photo the shadows at bottom right would point over to the left.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: John Giltinan, cooper, 220 and 222 Kent street - 'Alphabetical Directory' section of 1888 Sands. I wonder if the Mason Brothers had properties on both sides of the road?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The plot thickens ...! 220 Kent Street Google street view - maps.google.com/maps?q=220+Kent+Street,+Millers+Point,+Ne...

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] charming modern architecture on kent street!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/agrippinamaior] Yes, it is a classic example of how to de-humanize a street.  Nothing interesting to hang around for.  When will they ever learn?

 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Does Sands mention the business behind in Clarence(?) Street  - "[C]ook's Cottons" ?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Close! "[Br]ook's Cottons" - ie. JONAS BROOK AND BROTHERS, machine sewing cotton manufacturers, Sidney S. Thomas, agent, 89 Clarence Street. Telephone #298.

N.S.W. Telephone System Regulation 4. "With a view to facilitate business, and for the better conduct of the system, Telephone Messages containing unbecoming expressions must be refrained from, and language of an obscene nature, or of a character calculated to provoke a breach of the peace, is strictly forbidden. Any violation of this regulation will render the offenders liable to have their telephone instruments disconnected from the Telephone Exchange, and their lines dismantled."

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] BRILLIANT!

[Relieved to hear that there is nothing new about obscene phone calls]

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] just don't get me started about the destruction of kent and day streets and darling harbour. i'm all for progress and admit to being quite fond of (some) modern architecture ... but the complete destruction of traditional architecture, districts, ways of life and connections between precincts ... hmmmm *end of rant*
